page.title: 16OLD AGE PENSIONERS IN HALE.
page.content: A group of our{older residents}of Hale were interviewed whilst watching the bowling in Hale village. Their views are quite interesting. They find Hale to be a quiet village still with an adequate supply of{shops}such as clothes, chemists and grocers. They felt that there were too many estate agents and banks for the size of the village and that items were generally dearer than in Altrincham.{Traffic congestion and lack of car parking was a nuisance and the new hotel and car parking was described as a monstrosity. The O.A.P. club next to the bowling green is a favourite place to drink tea and chat about old times. Considering the increase in vandalism and crime the pensioners were concerned that the nearest{police station was in Altrincham!!.
